result.execSummary:
The deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[ml] Case called at 1:55PM
[All appearances via Zoom]
Defendant Martin J Worth appears by phone.
The Court was informed that Mr. Worth was aware of a warrant for his arrest, however, the warrant was not in proper form and could not be served.
The Court notes that this case is dismissed, but legal fees are still due.
The Defendant indicates that he was having housing problems, however he has found stable housing and employment.
The Court quashes the warrant in this case.
The Clerk informs the Court that book keeping has an updated payment plan for Mr. Worth. The Court recognizes this payment plan and instructs the Defendant to honor this plan.
The Court clarifies that payment fulfillment will be monitored by the Clerk of Courts book keeping department.
recess 2:07PM
Voluntary appearance on August 31, 2021 at 01:15 pm.

[MK] case called at 9:53am
Defendant Martin J Worth appears via Zoom audioconferencing on the Court's laptop computer.
Mr. Worth summarizes his hardship health and work circumstances. 
Martin Worth- sworn and testifies
--examination by the Court.  
The Court finds that there is a credible hardship. The Court defers Mr. Worth's installment payments for one year to 5/29/2021.  The Court orders that the Clerk of Courts is forbidden from attempting to intercept or execute anything with respect to bank accounts, and they are not to intercept any deposit into demand-deposit accounts or do anything else that a creditor may do or ordinarily does to obtain funds.  This Order is in place for one year.  
Mr. Worth verifies that the 401 1/2 College Avenue, Watertown WI 53094 remains current.
recess 10:01am

Case called at 11:01am [mo]
Defendant Martin J Worth in court with Attorney Lee J. Leverton.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance; indicates victim has been notified of todays court proceedings and likely outcome.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered; factual basis stipulated;the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty.

The STAYS entry of Judgement of Conviction and approves the Deferred Prosecution agreement 

The terms of the order for re-payment of Court appointed attorney fees remains as previously ordered. 
The Court reminds Mr. Worth that his bond and its conditions remains in effect until dismissed by the Court. 
recess: 11:17am

Case called at 3:54pm [mo]
Defendant Martin J Worth in court with Attorney Lee J. Leverton.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to the Defense's Response to State's Proposed Jury Instructions:
--no alternate needed
--The Court allows jurors to take notes and ask questions

As to the Defense's Motion in Limine:
--ADA Beck indicates that the State did file a written response

On the Defense's Motion To exclude other  Acts/Evidence:
--the State does not intend to offer any other acts
--the Court grants the Defense's Motion to exclude other acts/ evidence as outlined in paragraph 1 in the Motion in Limine

On the Defense's Motion to Impeach the State's Witness:
--arguments given by Counsel 
--The Court will not allow any impeachment of Mr. Wade Bellamy as set forth in paragraph 2 in the Motion in Limine

On the Defense's Motion for Introduction of Transcripts into Evidence: 
--The Court denies the Defense's Motion to allow Introduction of Transcripts into Evidence

Atty. Leverton indicates he wishes to appeal the Court's order

The Court directs Atty. Leverton to submit the Order by noon on 10/7/15
The Court notes that the Trial date remains on the calendar.

recess: 4:29pm
Two cases cited by Defendant in motions set for 09-29-15
States response to defense mtion(s) in limine
Defendant's answers to the Courts scheduling order
Defendant's
Motions in limine
Proposed order allowing a transcript into evidence
Motion in limine in re introduction of a transcript into evidence

Case called at 10:02am [mo]
Defendant Martin J Worth in court with Attorney Lee J. Leverton.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
recess: 10:02am--reconvene: 10:07am [to allow ADA Shock to retrieve file]

As to the State's Motion to Impeach the Defendant with Prior Convictions and Adjudications:
--Upon inquiry from the Court, Atty. Leverton indicates that he has NOT submitted a response to the State's motion because the Defense objects
--The Court indicates that this is against the Court's scheduling order; the Court sanctions Attorney Leverton in the amount of $100 this is to be deposited to the Clerk of Courts office within 48 hours.
--Atty. Leverton gives arguments against Mr. Worth's prior convictions being admissible at trial
--The Court denies the State's Motion Impeach Mr. Worth with Prior Convictions.

As to the State's Notice to Admits Statements made by the Defendant:
--The Court grants the State's Motion to Admit Statements 

As to the State's Motion in Limine:
--Attorney Leverton questions paragraph 8; the Court clarifies and grants the motion
--The Court allows Attorney Leverton to submit a motion if the Defense intends to submit evidence on 906.08 by 9/23/15 at 4:00pm; the Court further directs Atty. Leverton to submit any other motions by that time also.
--With no objection, the Court grants all other motions within the State's Motion in Limine

Atty. Leverton outlines the Motions he will be submitting.
--Atty. Leverton notes that he has submitted 2 documents, which have been marked Defendants exh. #1 and #2, these are to be used at the anticipated Motion Hearing, since the Motions were not heard at todays hearing. 
recess: 10:23am

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Scheduling notice
Conditions of Bond include: to comply with the existing Domestic Abuse Injunction.

[MK] case called at 2:37pm. 
Defendant Martin J Worth in court.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
The Court approves the Petition for appointment of counsel; an attorney will be assigned.  The Court requires Mr. Worth to make $30 payments per month commencing on 5/14/15 and on the 14th day of each month thereafter until further order of the Court. 
The Court adjourns the Initial Appearance. 

The Court requires $1,000  signature bond, with conditions: 
--to comply with the existing Domestic Abuse Injunction. .
recess 2:42pm. 


NEXT:  (1) appointment of counsel    (2)  Adjourned Initial Appearance on 5/5/15 at 2:00pm.
